snippet: In addition to the cease-fire, to start Saturday, the Myanmar government said it would pursue peace talks, but it was unclear how the rebels would react to the government’s overtures.
abstract: Myanmar government announces what appears to be unilateral cease-fire in its offensive against ethnic Kachin rebels, after weeks of intensive fighting near border with China;  also says it will pursue peace talks, but it is unclear how rebels will react to government’s overtures.

byline.original: By THOMAS FULLER and EDWARD WONG
byline.contributor: Thomas Fuller reported from Bangkok and Edward Wong from Beijing. Wai Moe contributed reporting from Yangon, Myanmar.

lead_paragraph: In addition to the cease-fire, to start Saturday, the Myanmar government said it would pursue peace talks, but it was unclear how the rebels would react to the government’s overtures.

headline.seo: Myanmar to End Assault Against Kachin Rebels
headline.main: Myanmar Announces a Cease-Fire in Assault Against Kachin Rebels
headline.print_headline: Myanmar Announces a Cease-Fire in Assault Against Kachin Rebels
